title: Hiker's 3-Hour Trek Turns Into 10-Day Ordeal, Drinks Boot Water To Survive
content: Lukas McClish, a 34-year-old from Boulder Creek, California, went missing for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains after setting out for a day hike on June 11th.
summary: Lukas McClish, a 34-year-old from Boulder Creek, California, went missing for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains after setting out for a day hike on June 11th.

title: Barack Obama's Half-Sister Among Protesters Tear-Gassed In Kenya: Report
content: Kenyan activist Auma Obama, the half-sister of former U.S. President Barack Obama, was among protesters tear-gassed on Tuesday during demonstrations outside the parliament building in Nairobi, a CNN interview showed.
summary: Kenyan activist Auma Obama, the half-sister of former U.S. President Barack Obama, was among protesters tear-gassed on Tuesday during demonstrations outside the parliament building in Nairobi, a CNN interview showed.

title: Jay Slater: All About UK Teen Missing In Tenerife For Over A Week

summary: Jay Slater, a 19-year-old from Oswaldtwistle, Lancashire, disappeared while on vacation in Tenerife after attending a music festival with friends.

title: "Unacceptably High": Alcohol Kills Nearly 3 Million Every Year, Says WHO
content: Alcohol kills nearly three million people annually, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday, adding that while the death rate had dropped slightly in recent years it remained "unacceptably high".
summary: Alcohol kills nearly three million people annually, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday, adding that while the death rate had dropped slightly in recent years it remained "unacceptably high".

title: Pakistan To Re-Install Maharaja Ranjit Singh's Statue At Kartarpur Sahib
content: Pakistan's Punjab government said on Tuesday that it will install the restored statue of the first ruler of the Sikh Empire, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, at Kartarpur Sahib on Wednesday so that visiting Sikhs from India would get to view it too.
summary: Pakistan's Punjab government said on Tuesday that it will install the restored statue of the first ruler of the Sikh Empire, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, at Kartarpur Sahib on Wednesday so that visiting Sikhs from India would get to view it too.

title: Court Frees Man Of Rape Charges As Woman Took 'Too Long' To React

title: US Reacts To Video Of Injured Palestinian Tied To Israeli Military Jeep
content: The US State Department on Monday said a video of a wounded Palestinian man strapped on a military jeep by Israeli forces was "shocking" and urged a swift investigation to hold those responsible to account.
summary: The US State Department on Monday said a video of a wounded Palestinian man strapped on a military jeep by Israeli forces was "shocking" and urged a swift investigation to hold those responsible to account.

title: 1 Shot Dead, Parts Of Kenya Parliament On Fire During Protests
content: Kenyan protesters breached parliament barricades on Tuesday and entered the complex where lawmakers were debating contentious tax hike proposals that have sparked widespread anger, AFP journalists saw.
summary: Kenyan protesters breached parliament barricades on Tuesday and entered the complex where lawmakers were debating contentious tax hike proposals that have sparked widespread anger, AFP journalists saw.

title: Watch: What Pilot Does After Plane's Canopy Bursts Open Mid-Air

title: Antarctic Study Reveals "Tipping Point" For Runaway Melting Of Ice Sheets
content: Scientists have discovered a new tipping point toward "runaway melting" of Antarctic ice sheets, caused by warm ocean water intruding between the ice and the land it sits on, according to a study published on Tuesday.
summary: Scientists have discovered a new tipping point toward "runaway melting" of Antarctic ice sheets, caused by warm ocean water intruding between the ice and the land it sits on, according to a study published on Tuesday.

title: Why Is Indian-Origin Astronaut Sunita Williams Stuck In Space?
content: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams is stuck on the International Space Station (ISS) after glitches were found in the Boeing spaceship they travelled in.
summary: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams is stuck on the International Space Station (ISS) after glitches were found in the Boeing spaceship they travelled in.

title: "Elated": WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange's Wife On Landmark Plea Deal

title: Israeli Air Strike Kills 10 Family Members Of Hamas Chief: Gaza Officials
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said an Israeli air strike early Tuesday killed 10 family members of Hamas's Qatar-based chief Ismail Haniyeh, including his sister.

title: Sedentary, Non-Coffee Drinkers At 60% More Risk Of Dying, Study Finds
content: Non-coffee drinkers who sat for six or more hours a day were at almost 60 per cent higher risk of dying compared to coffee drinkers sitting for less than six hours, according to a research.
summary: Non-coffee drinkers who sat for six or more hours a day were at almost 60 per cent higher risk of dying compared to coffee drinkers sitting for less than six hours, according to a research.

title: Israel's Top Court Rules Army Must Draft Ultra-Orthodox Jewish Students
content: Israel's Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that the government must draft ultra-Orthodox Jewish seminary students to the conscript military, a decree likely to send shockwaves through Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition.
summary: Israel's Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that the government must draft ultra-Orthodox Jewish seminary students to the conscript military, a decree likely to send shockwaves through Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition.

title: Illegal Hajj Routes Claim Hundreds Of Lives: A Grave Warning To Pilgrims
content: Hundreds of people died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage due to the extreme heat in Mecca with temperatures soaring past 50 degrees Celsius.
summary: Hundreds of people died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage due to the extreme heat in Mecca with temperatures soaring past 50 degrees Celsius.

title: Israeli Airstrikes Kill 24 In Gaza As Tanks Deepen Incursion Into Rafah
content: Israeli forces killed at least 24 Palestinians in three separate airstrikes on Gaza City early on Tuesday, health officials said, while tanks deepened their incursion into the town of Rafah in the south of the enclave.
summary: Israeli forces killed at least 24 Palestinians in three separate airstrikes on Gaza City early on Tuesday, health officials said, while tanks deepened their incursion into the town of Rafah in the south of the enclave.
